questions.question: Choose the correct option to complete the sentence: 'Had I known about the traffic, I ___ an earlier train.'
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'Would have taken' is used in this inverted third conditional structure.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. In the third conditional, 'would have' + past participle is used to express a hypothetical past result.
questions.explanation: This is an example of an inverted third conditional sentence. 'Had I known' replaces 'If I had known,' and 'would have taken' is used in the main clause.

questions.question: Choose the correct option to complete the sentence: 'Not only ___ late, but he also forgot to bring the documents.'
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'Was he' correctly follows the inversion rule after 'Not only' in formal contexts.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. After 'Not only,' inversion is required, so the correct structure is 'was he.'
questions.explanation: When 'Not only' begins a sentence, the following clause must have subject-verb inversion, making 'was he' the correct choice.
